H_en: pink, several kinds of pink, Danthus, D. caryophyllus, several members of the Caryophillaceæ
Comment: on p. 501 the headword is "KARAMBÉL [kåråmbēl]" but the etymology reads "kårånbēl < *karampil ← Cum *karampil, karamfil". I assumed the form with "n" is a typo, since typically an /n/ would assimilate to /m/ before /b/ and the donor word itself contains an /m/ as well.

H_en: secretion, mucus discharged from the eyes
Comment: according to the corrigenda-section on p. 1494 I changed "čapa ← WOT *čapaγ" to "čapa < *čapaγ ← WOT *čapaγ"
according to the corrigenda-section on p. 1494 I changed "dʹertʹå < *ǰarta ← WOT *ǰarta" to "dʹertʹå < *ǰarta ← WOT *yarta"
according to the corrigenda-section on p. 1494 I changed "dʹertʹān < *ǰartān < *ǰartaγan ← WOT *ǰartaγan" to "dʹertʹān < *ǰartān < *ǰartaγan ← WOT *yartaγan"
On p. 439 the etymology reads "ige < *üge ← *ügä". I assumed this must be in fact "ige < *üge ← WOT *ügä"

H_en: Ismaelite, name of an ethnic group in Medieval Hungary
Comment: On p. 177 the etymology reads "bösörmēń < *besermen ← *besermen" I assumed this must be in fact "bösörmēń < *besermen ← WOT *besermen"

The entry "bűbáj" on p. 190 is omitted from the dataset because compounding ("bű+báj") happened only in Hungarian. Therefore, there is no counterpart to be aligned with in West Old Turkic. For the etymology of "bű" one is supposed to look up "bűvös" or "bölcs". The former seems to be lacking from the dictionary, and the latter doesn't explain the etymology of "bű".
The full etymology would be "ēs < es ← WOT *es(V)" but I pretended the "(V)" wasn't there because this simplifies things.

H_en: sexual organ of large male animals, of a bull; a whip made from it
Comment: The full etymology is "čök < *čük ← WOT *čükV" and I left the "V" on purpose in the WOT word because loanpy was designed to treat "V" as "any vowel" and this data set serves as an input for loanpy. Might be that this causes a BIPA error.

H_en: trap; snare (for catching birds); bird cage
Comment: see headword CIGLE in original source (nested entry)

H_en: a kind of willow, used for baskets and in viticulture, Salix purpurea
Comment: see headword CIGLE in original source (nested entry)
see headword CIGLE in original source (nested entry)
See headword "KÖPÖNYEG" (with a "G"). The etymological part features a "k" ("köpönyek"), therefore the entry in this data set also contains a "k". The subentry "köpeny" was omitted.
See headword OK in original (nested entry).
Sub-entries "okos" and "oktalan" are omitted, because no WOT root is given. "oktat" has a separate entry, since WOT root is given.
